alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:48PM EST until further notice by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Charles River At Dover affecting Norfolk and Middlesex Counties. For the Charles River...including Dover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Charles River at Dover. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding will affect a few homes in Needham along Fisher Street, as well as a portion of Route 109 at the Medfield and Millis town line. Some flooding is also likely on the South Natick and Wellesley town line along River Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning and continue rising to 6.0 feet Thursday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.1 feet on 10/19/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening. late tonight at 100 AM EST.
